line.comment: * Maximum number of Fighters in a system for it to be considered a viable target at all.
* Maximum range raiders will travel from their home-base. Don't want them running clear across the entire map.
* Maximum amount of [M4] losses the squad can incur before the squadron is deemed ineffective.

line.text: 'A new version of the Raider script is being loaded for %s.'

line.comment: * Anything past this point is an Order for the Squadron Leader. Followers just follow them but don't have their own logic.
* write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='%s squadron leader is STARTING', [THIS], null, null, null, null
* Start out fully topped up.
* Attack any enemies.
* If topped up and just waiting, Every 90 minutes Randomly choose a new home sector
* Not topped up. Go home if not there already.
* Go to home sector if not there.
* just hang around if no one is fighting.
* We force a gap of 20 minues between attacks.
* get our list of current enemies and pick one at random. Ignore Yaki.
* Add-Ons 1.2: Phanon is now an eligible target, if the player did not join the OCV. This encourages the player to help defend Phanon.
* Add-Ons 1.5.1: Fixed relation check; -50k is well within rank -4. Rank -4 is -100k to -10k.
* On hard difficulty, the A.I. will always give 50% prioritization to the Player as it's target. Welcome to hell boys.
* Add-Ons 1.3: On insane, chance is instead 75%.

line.text: '%s - Is at full strength, and has found a valid Enemy: %s'

line.comment: * Leave them alone if they have no sectors.
* sort $sectors by distance (High to Low) from [HOMEBASE]
* If no sectors at all to attack for this enemy, cycle again after a delay, as we may have other enemy races that are within range.
* Move from system to system until no viable target systems remain.
* Break out of loop if a truce was signed.

line.text: '%s has completed the Attack Run in %s with %s kills'

line.comment: * This is updated at the end of AttackRun: above. If we are no longer at sufficient strength, terminate run.
* Under strength, or no more systems are worth attacking, so we go back to the start.
* Search through the closest 5 enemy sectors (from your home base) for a viable sector. These are sorted starting with the ones that are farthest from the homebase.
* find best system to attack based on number of TS targets and enemy power.
* closest sector is at end of $ssectors
* Limit range of valid targets to X jumps.
* Evaluate a limited number of sectors.

line.text: '%s - No enemy sectors found with any value'
'%s - No %s systems with within range (%s jumps to home %s)'

line.comment: * Goes to $bestSector and attacks TS ships until the sector drops below required value.
* go there and attack.

line.text: '%s Is Starting an Attack Run and is is Moving to Target Sector %s'

line.comment: * If for some reason we didn't make it there, just terminate the run.

line.text: '%s didnt make it to sector %s. Ending Attack run.'

line.comment: * While the sector has value, keep attacking haulers.
* Stop attack if the sector no longer has value.
* Get out of attack run if a truce was signed.
* If we are no longer near full strength, terminate run.
* Find valid targets. (Add-Ons 1.2: player's TPs count.)

line.text: '%s continuing attack in Sector %s. %s enemy targets present. %s targets killed.'

line.comment: * Attack, but don't follow them out of sector.

line.text: '%s - Enemy %s was targeted but not killed. Enemy Location = %s'
'%s - Enemy %s was killed. Total: %s, Enemy sector = %s'

line.comment: * No 'valid' enemy ship exists out of GetBestTarget. Possibly some TS is there, but we're too slow to catch it, so it's coming back with 'null' in the enemyship.
* It's important to note that the GetSectorValue routine does not look at ship speeds, it only looks at quantity of TS targets vs enemy fighters.
* end whle $sectorValue

line.text: '%s - %s are no longer an Enemy. Terminating attack'
'%s - Squadron is no longer at sufficient strength. Terminatin attack.'
'%s - Sector %s no longer has Value. Terminating attack.'

line.comment: * Ensures we are near full strength.
* Returns $SquadIsStrong
* We have a full squad. Just return ok.
* Check composition of M4's needed. If we need 4 or more, we're too weak.
* no M4's needed. We will call it good, even if we're missing an M3

line.text: '%s Squadron is strong enough and needs only %s M4s'

line.comment: * Search through $targets, finding the best target for [THIS] to hit. Return in $enemyship
* If we're not at least 25% faster than the slowest target, there's no point in chasing.

line.text: '%s - Could not find a slow Enemy'

line.comment: * find value of $sector and place value into $sectorValue
* Value is based on number of enemy TS ships and lack of opposing Fighters.
* If it's not a viable sector, set $sectorValue to 0.
* Place a hard limit on how many enemy fighters can be here for us to consider it as viable. No matter how juicy the system is, if you die it won't do any good.
* Add-Ons 1.2: player's TP count.
* Sector value is number of TS targets - Number of enemy fighters.

sval.val: A new version of the Raider script is being loaded for %s.
Ожидаю
меняет домашнюю базу на
Возвращаюсь домой
Ожидание подкрепления

%s - Is at full strength, and has found a valid Enemy: %s

Отступает

%s - No %s systems with within range (%s jumps to home %s)

Атакую %s

%s - %s are no longer an Enemy. Terminating attack
%s - Squadron is no longer at sufficient strength. Terminatin attack.
%s - Sector %s no longer has Value. Terminating attack.
%s Squadron is strong enough and needs only %s M4s
%s - Could not find a slow Enemy

%s is going home to %s
Возвращаюсь домой
Sector value for %s = %s
